items.title: Can Pollution From Industrial Animal Agriculture Be Controlled?
items.description: Most of the meat we eat in the United States isn’t raised on small farms or fenced fields, as it was decades ago. Today it comes from large concentrated animal feeding operations, also known as CAFOs. These industrial facilities house thousands of animals in close quarters—generating tremendous amounts of manure, climate-polluting methane and a host […]
